creator: kroll@alltel.net
text: If I set the root context to a particular web application that is waiting to be deployed from a WAR, the server complains that the directory does not exist and aborts. In other words, it checks for the existence of the directory before the WAR has been deployed to create it.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
If you explicitely define a context in server.xml and specify the root path, 
then indeed that path has to exist.
OTOH, you can also specify the path to the WAR file, in which case the webapp 
will be run without extracting. Webapps which don't use direct filesystem 
access (and instead rely on getResource() / getResourceAsStream() calls) should 
work fine that way.
Close the bug based on Remy's explanation of correct configuration settings.
